titleStmt.title: To a vertuous and judicious lady who (for the exercise of her devotion) built a closet, wherein to secure the most sacred Booke of Common-Prayer, from the view and violence of the enemies thereof, the sectaries and schismatiques of this kingdome. / Written by a most orthodox, moderate, and judicious divine, a banished minister of this miserable kingdome.

notesStmt.note: Verse - "Since it hath pleas'd our wife and new-born State"...
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
